TEXT.English: [TAB]In its native Central America and South America, rubber has been collected for a long time. The Mesoamerican civilizations used rubber mostly from Castilla elastica. The Ancient Mesoamericans had a ball game using rubber balls, and a few Pre-Columbian rubber balls have been found (always in sites that were flooded under fresh water), the earliest dating to about 1600 BC. According to Bernal DÃ­az del Castillo, the Spanish Conquistadores were so astounded by the vigorous bouncing of the rubber balls of the Aztecs that they wondered if the balls were enchanted by evil spirits. The Maya also made a type of temporary rubber shoe by dipping their feet into a latex mixture. Rubber was used in various other contexts, such as strips to hold stone and metal tools to wooden handles, and padding for the tool handles. While the ancient Mesoamericans did not have vulcanization, they developed organic methods of processing the rubber with similar results, mixing the raw latex with various saps and juices of other vines, particularly Ipomoea alba, a species of Morning glory. In Brazil the natives understood the use of rubber to make water-resistant cloth. A story says that the first European to return to Portugal from Brazil with samples of such water-repellent rubberized cloth so shocked people that he was brought to court on the charge of witchcraft.[PARAGRAPH:1]When samples of rubber first arrived in England, it was observed by Joseph Priestley, in 1770, that a piece of the material was extremely good for rubbing out pencil marks on paper.[PARAGRAPH:1]The para rubber tree initially grew in South America, where it was the main source of what limited amount of latex rubber was consumed during much of the 19th century. About 100 years ago, the Congo Free State in Africa was a significant source of natural rubber latex, mostly gathered by forced labor. The Congo Free State was forged and ruled as a personal colony by the Belgian King Leopold II where millions of Africans died as a result of lust for rubber and rubber profits. After repeated efforts rubber was successfully cultivated in Southeast Asia, where it is now widely grown.
TEXT.French: [TAB]En Amérique Centrale et en Amérique du Sud, le caoutchouc a été rassemblé pendant longtemps par les indigènes. TODO Les civilisations de Mesoamerican ont employé le caoutchouc la plupart du temps de l'elastica de la Castille. Le Mesoamericans antique a eu un jeu de boule en utilisant les boules en caoutchouc, et quelques boules en caoutchouc Pré-Colombiennes ont été trouvées (toujours dans les emplacements qui ont été inondés sous l'eau doux), le plus tôt datant environ à 1600 AVANT JÉSUS CHRIST. Selon Bernal Díaz del Castillo, le Conquistadores espagnol étaient ainsi étonné par le rebondissement vigoureux des boules en caoutchouc de l'Aztecs qu'ils se sont demandés si les boules étaient enchantées par des spiritueux mauvais. Le Maya a également fait un type de la chaussure en caoutchouc provisoire en plongeant leurs pieds dans un mélange de latex. Le caoutchouc a été employé dans de divers autres contextes, tels que des bandes pour tenir des outils de pierre et en métal sur les poignées en bois, et la remplissage pour les poignées d'outil. Tandis que le Mesoamericans antique n'avait pas la vulcanisation, elles ont développé des méthodes organiques de traiter le caoutchouc avec les résultats semblables, mélangeant le latex cru à de divers sèves et jus d'autres vignes, en particulier Ipomoea alba, des espèces de gloire de matin. Au Brésil les indigènes ont compris l'utilisation du caoutchouc de faire le tissu résistant à l'eau. Une histoire indique que le premier Européen à retourner au Portugal du Brésil avec des échantillons d'un tel tissu caoutchouté hydrofuge a ainsi choqué les personnes qu'il a été apportées à la cour sur la charge des échantillons de witchcraft.[PARAGRAPH:1]When du caoutchouc est arrivé la première fois en Angleterre, il a été observé par Joseph Priestley, en 1770, qu'un morceau du matériel était extrêmement bon pour frotter hors des marques de crayon sur l'arbre en caoutchouc de paper.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Para. s'est au commencement développé en Amérique Du sud, où c'était la source principale de quelle quantité limitée du caoutchouc de latex a été consommé pendant le une grande partie du 19ème siècle. Il y a environ 100 ans, l'état libre du Congo en Afrique était une source significative de latex normal, la plupart du temps recueillie par le travail obligatoire. L'état libre du Congo a été forgé et a régné en tant que colonie personnelle par le Roi belge Leopold II où des millions d'Africains morts en raison de la convoitise pour le caoutchouc et des bénéfices en caoutchouc. Après que répété le caoutchouc d'efforts a été avec succès cultivé en Asie du Sud-Est, où il est maintenant largement développé.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In its native Central America and South America, rubber has been collected for a long time. The Mesoamerican civilizations used rubber mostly from Castilla elastica. The Ancient Mesoamericans had a ball game using rubber balls, and a few Pre-Columbian rubber balls have been found (always in sites that were flooded under fresh water), the earliest dating to about 1600 BC. According to Bernal DÃ­az del Castillo, the Spanish Conquistadores were so astounded by the vigorous bouncing of the rubber balls of the Aztecs that they wondered if the balls were enchanted by evil spirits. The Maya also made a type of temporary rubber shoe by dipping their feet into a latex mixture. Rubber was used in various other contexts, such as strips to hold stone and metal tools to wooden handles, and padding for the tool handles. While the ancient Mesoamericans did not have vulcanization, they developed organic methods of processing the rubber with similar results, mixing the raw latex with various saps and juices of other vines, particularly Ipomoea alba, a species of Morning glory. In Brazil the natives understood the use of rubber to make water-resistant cloth. A story says that the first European to return to Portugal from Brazil with samples of such water-repellent rubberized cloth so shocked people that he was brought to court on the charge of witchcraft.[PARAGRAPH:1]When samples of rubber first arrived in England, it was observed by Joseph Priestley, in 1770, that a piece of the material was extremely good for rubbing out pencil marks on paper.[PARAGRAPH:1]The para rubber tree initially grew in South America, where it was the main source of what limited amount of latex rubber was consumed during much of the 19th century. About 100 years ago, the Congo Free State in Africa was a significant source of natural rubber latex, mostly gathered by forced labor. The Congo Free State was forged and ruled as a personal colony by the Belgian King Leopold II where millions of Africans died as a result of lust for rubber and rubber profits. After repeated efforts rubber was successfully cultivated in Southeast Asia, where it is now widely grown.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]In relativi America Centrale e Sudamerica natali, la gomma è stata raccolta a lungo. Le civilizzazioni di Mesoamerican hanno usato la gomma principalmente dal elastica della Castiglia. Il Mesoamericans antico ha avuto un gioco della sfera usando le sfere di gomma ed alcune sfere di gomma Pre-Colombiane sono state trovate (sempre in luoghi che sono stati sommersi sotto acqua dolce), il più in anticipo che data BC a circa 1600. Secondo Bernal Díaz del Castillo, il Conquistadores spagnolo era in modo da sbalordito dal rimbalzo vigoroso delle sfere di gomma del Aztecs che si sono domandati se le sfere fossero incantate dagli alcoolici diabolici. Il maya inoltre ha fatto un tipo del pattino di gomma provvisorio tuffando i loro piedi in una miscela del lattice. La gomma è stata usata nei vari contesti, quali le strisce per tenere gli attrezzi del metallo e della pietra alle maniglie di legno ed al riempimento per le maniglie dell'attrezzo. Mentre il Mesoamericans antico non ha avuto vulcanizzazione, hanno messo a punto i metodi organici di elaborazione della gomma con risultati simili, mescolanti il lattice grezzo con vario fiaccano e spremute di altre viti, specialmente Ipomoea alba, una specie di glory di mattina. Nel Brasile i nativi hanno capito l'uso di gomma fare il panno resistente all'acqua. Una storia dice che il primo europeo da rinviare nel Portogallo dal Brasile con i campioni di tale panno gommato idrorepellente così ha scosso la gente che è stato portato alla corte sulla carica dei campioni di witchcraft.[PARAGRAPH:1]When di gomma in primo luogo è arrivato in Inghilterra, esso è stato osservato da Joseph Priestley, in 1770, che una parte del materiale era estremamente buona per la lucidatura verso l'esterno i contrassegni della matita sull'albero della gomma di paper.[PARAGRAPH:1]The paragrafi inizialmente si è sviluppata nel Sudamerica, in cui era la fonte principale di che quantità limitata di gomma del lattice è stato consumato durante il gran parte del diciannovesimo secolo. Circa 100 anni fa, il Congo libero Dichiara in Africa era una fonte significativa di latice di gomma naturale, principalmente riunita dal lavoro forzato. Il Congo libero Dichiara è stato forgiato e regolato come colonia personale dal re belga Leopold II dove milioni di Africani sono morto come conseguenza di lust per gomma ed i profitti della gomma. Dopo che ripetuto la gomma di sforzi si coltivi con successo in Asia sudorientale, in cui ora ampiamente si sviluppa.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En su America Central y Suramérica nativas, el caucho se ha recogido durante mucho tiempo. Las civilizaciones de Mesoamerican utilizaron el caucho sobre todo del elastica de Castilla. El Mesoamericans antiguo tenía un juego de la bola usando las bolas de goma, y se han encontrado algunas bolas de goma Pre-Colombinas (siempre en los sitios que fueron inundados debajo del agua dulce), el más temprano que fechaba a cerca de 1600 A.C.. Según Bernal Díaz del Castillo, el Conquistadores español estaba así que asombrado por despedir vigoroso de las bolas de goma del Aztecs que se preguntaban si las bolas fueron encantadas por alcoholes malvados. El maya también hizo un tipo del zapato de goma temporal sumergiendo sus pies en una mezcla del látex. El caucho fue utilizado en contextos otros, tales como tiras para sostener las herramientas de la piedra y del metal a las manijas de madera, y al acolchado para las manijas de la herramienta. Mientras que el Mesoamericans antiguo no tenía vulcanización, desarrollaron los métodos orgánicos de procesar el caucho con resultados similares, mezclando el látex crudo con las varios savias y jugos de otras vides, particularmente Ipomoea alba, una especie de la gloria de mañana. En el Brasil los naturales entendían el uso del caucho de hacer el paño hidrófugo. Una historia dice que el primer europeo a volver a Portugal del Brasil con las muestras de tal paño recubierto de goma impermeable dio una sacudida eléctrica tan a gente a que le trajeron a la corte en la carga de muestras de witchcraft.[PARAGRAPH:1]When del caucho primero llegó en Inglaterra, él fue observado por José Priestley, en 1770, que un pedazo del material era extremadamente bueno para frotar fuera de marcas del lápiz en árbol del caucho de paper.[PARAGRAPH:1]The párrafos creció inicialmente en Suramérica, donde estaba la fuente principal de qué cantidad limitada de caucho del látex fue consumido durante mucho del diecinueveavo siglo. Hace aproximadamente 100 años, el estado libre de Congo en África era una fuente significativa del látex de caucho natural, recolectada sobre todo por el trabajo forzado. El estado libre de Congo fue forjado y gobernó como colonia personal del rey belga Leopold II donde millones de africanos murieron como resultado de la lujuria para el caucho y los beneficios del caucho. Después de que estuvo repetido el caucho de los esfuerzos fuera cultivado con éxito en Asia suroriental, en donde ahora se crece extensamente.
